newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain ups winter cereal forecast to 12.76 mln T.
newsitem.headline: Spain ups winter cereal forecast to 12.76 mln T.

text.p: Spain's 1997 winter harvest of barley and wheat is forecast at around 12.76 million tonnes, provisional May estimates from the Agriculture Ministry showed on Tuesday.
The forecast was revised up from an April estimate of 12.46 million tonnes. Output last year was 16.8 million tonnes.
This year's maize harvest is expected to be 4.15 million tonnes, versus a harvest of 3.70 million tonnes in 1996, the ministry said.
Barley output was estimated at 8.22 million tonnes in May versus 7.85 million in April.
Soft wheat was forecast at 3.39 million tonnes, compared with a forecast of 3.41 million tonnes in April. Durum wheat is forecast at 1.16 million tonnes versus 1.20 million tonnes the month earlier.
